verses.kjv: Canst thou draw out leviathan with an hook? or his tongue with a cord which thou lettest down?
verses.ct: Can you pull leviathan out with a fishhook? Can you tie down his tongue with a rope?

verses.kjv: Canst thou put an hook into his nose? or bore his jaw through with a thorn?
verses.ct: Can you put a cord through his nose? Can you pierce his jaw with a hook?

verses.kjv: Will he make many supplications unto thee? will he speak soft words unto thee?
verses.ct: Will he beg you for mercy? Will he plead with you using gentle words?

verses.kjv: Will he make a covenant with thee? wilt thou take him for a servant for ever?
verses.ct: Will he enter into a covenant with you? Will you take him as your permanent servant?

verses.kjv: Wilt thou play with him as with a bird? or wilt thou bind him for thy maidens?
verses.ct: Will you play with him like a pet bird? Will you put him on a leash for your girls to enjoy?

verses.kjv: Shall the companions make a banquet of him? shall they part him among the merchants?
verses.ct: Will traders try to bargain over him? Will merchants divide him up among themselves?

verses.kjv: Canst thou fill his skin with barbed irons? or his head with fish spears?
verses.ct: Can you fill his hide with harpoons? Can you pierce his head with fishing spears?

verses.kjv: Lay thine hand upon him, remember the battle, do no more.
verses.ct: Go ahead — lay your hand on him. You'll remember that fight and never try it again.

verses.kjv: Behold, the hope of him is in vain: shall not one be cast down even at the sight of him?
verses.ct: Any hope of overpowering him is pointless. Just the sight of him is enough to knock a person down.

verses.kjv: None is so fierce that dare stir him up: who then is able to stand before me?
verses.ct: No one is brave enough to provoke him. So who then could possibly stand up against me?

verses.kjv: Who hath prevented me, that I should repay him? whatsoever is under the whole heaven is mine.
verses.ct: Who has given me something first that I need to repay? Everything under all of heaven belongs to me.

verses.kjv: I will not conceal his parts, nor his power, nor his comely proportion.
verses.ct: I won't leave out the details of his limbs, his strength, or his impressive form.

verses.kjv: Who can discover the face of his garment? or who can come to him with his double bridle?
verses.ct: Who can strip off his outer armor? Who can approach him with a bridle for his double jaw?

verses.kjv: Who can open the doors of his face? his teeth are terrible round about.
verses.ct: Who can pry open the doors of his mouth? His teeth are absolutely terrifying all around.

verses.kjv: His scales are his pride, shut up together as with a close seal.
verses.ct: His rows of scales are his pride, locked together tight like a seal.

verses.kjv: One is so near to another, that no air can come between them.
verses.ct: Each one is so close to the next that not even air can pass between them.

verses.kjv: They are joined one to another, they stick together, that they cannot be sundered.
verses.ct: They are fused to one another, interlocked so tightly that nothing can separate them.

verses.kjv: By his neesings a light doth shine, and his eyes are like the eyelids of the morning.
verses.ct: His sneezes flash with light, and his eyes glow like the first rays of dawn.

verses.kjv: Out of his mouth go burning lamps, and sparks of fire leap out.
verses.ct: Flaming torches shoot from his mouth, and sparks of fire fly out.

verses.kjv: Out of his nostrils goeth smoke, as out of a seething pot or caldron.
verses.ct: Smoke pours from his nostrils like steam from a boiling pot or cauldron.

verses.kjv: His breath kindleth coals, and a flame goeth out of his mouth.
verses.ct: His breath sets coals ablaze, and flames burst from his mouth.

verses.kjv: In his neck remaineth strength, and sorrow is turned into joy before him.
verses.ct: Enormous strength resides in his neck, and terror dances ahead of him wherever he goes.

verses.kjv: The flakes of his flesh are joined together: they are firm in themselves; they cannot be moved.
verses.ct: The folds of his flesh are tightly joined together — they are solid and immovable.

verses.kjv: His heart is as firm as a stone; yea, as hard as a piece of the nether millstone.
verses.ct: His chest is as hard as rock — as solid as the lower grinding stone.

verses.kjv: When he raiseth up himself, the mighty are afraid: by reason of breakings they purify themselves.
verses.ct: When he rises up, even the mightiest are terrified. They stumble back in panic.

verses.kjv: The sword of him that layeth at him cannot hold: the spear, the dart, nor the habergeon.
verses.ct: No sword that strikes him can hold up — not a spear, a javelin, or a coat of armor can stop him.

verses.kjv: He esteemeth iron as straw, and brass as rotten wood.
verses.ct: He treats iron like straw and bronze like rotting wood.

verses.kjv: The arrow cannot make him flee: slingstones are turned with him into stubble.
verses.ct: Arrows can't make him run away. Sling stones bounce off him like bits of chaff.

verses.kjv: Darts are counted as stubble: he laugheth at the shaking of a spear.
verses.ct: Clubs feel like straw to him. He laughs at the thrust of a spear.

verses.kjv: Sharp stones are under him: he spreadeth sharp pointed things upon the mire.
verses.ct: His underside is like jagged pottery shards — he drags across the mud like a threshing sledge.

verses.kjv: He maketh the deep to boil like a pot: he maketh the sea like a pot of ointment.
verses.ct: He churns the deep water until it boils like a pot. He stirs the sea like a bowl of ointment.

verses.kjv: He maketh a path to shine after him; one would think the deep to be hoary.
verses.ct: He leaves a glowing trail behind him, making the depths look white-haired with foam.

verses.kjv: Upon earth there is not his like, who is made without fear.
verses.ct: Nothing on earth is his equal — a creature made completely without fear.

verses.kjv: He beholdeth all high things: he is a king over all the children of pride.
verses.ct: He looks down on everything that is proud. He is king over every arrogant creature.
